cat.lump.aq.textextraction.wikipedia.categories

Class CategoryExplorer

  • java.lang.Object
    • cat.lump.aq.textextraction.wikipedia.categories.CategoryExplorer

  • public class CategoryExplorer
extends java.lang.Object

    The CategoryExplorer class is used to explore the categories of Wikipedia. These categories are organized as a digraph where the vertex represents them and one edge represent a relation of subcategorization. It means, an arc e = (x,y) defines that the category y is a subcategory of the category x.

    This class is also used to obtain the subgraph related to a specific domain. This process requires the construction of a domain vocabulary which can be created with this class.

    Author:
    cmops

      • createCategoryVocabulary

        public DomainVocabulary createCategoryVocabulary(Category category)
                                          throws WikiApiException
        Creates the vocabulary related to the given category. This vocabulary is composed by the terms that appears in the category articles and its frequency.
        Parameters:
        category - The category.
        Returns:
        The vocabulary related to the category.
        Throws:
        WikiApiException

      • isDomain

        public boolean isDomain(Category category,
               DomainVocabulary vocabulary)
                 throws WikiTitleParsingException
        Checks if a category belongs to the domain defined by the given vocabulary. A category belongs to one domain if its title contains at least one word which is included in the domain vocabulary.
        Parameters:
        category - The category to check.
        vocabulary - The vocabulary of the desired domain.
        Returns:
        true if the category belongs to the domain. Otherwise, false.
        Throws:
        WikiTitleParsingException

      • scoreDomain

        public java.util.ArrayList<GroupOfCategories> scoreDomain(DomainVocabulary vocabulary,
                                                 Category root)
        Scores all the groups which compose a domain. The score of each group is calculated using GroupOfCategories.getScore(). A group of categories is defined in this case as the set of categories which are at the same distance from a root category.
        Parameters:
        vocabulary - The vocabulary of the domain.
        root - The category which defines the domain.
        Returns:
        A list with all the groups of categories which can be accessed from the given root. All the groups has been scored and are indexed by the distance from the root category. It means, the position 0 of the list only contains the root category because it is the unique category at distance 0 from itself; the position i contains all the categories at distance i from the root category.

      • scoreDomain

        public java.util.ArrayList<GroupOfCategories> scoreDomain(DomainVocabulary vocabulary,
                                                 Category root,
                                                 int maxDistance)
        Scores the groups which compose a domain and are at most as far as the maxDistance parameter defines. The score of each group is calculated using GroupOfCategories.getScore(). A group of categories is defined in this case as the set of categories which are at the same distance from a root category.
        Parameters:
        vocabulary - The vocabulary of the domain.
        root - The category which defines the domain.
        maxDistance - Maximum distance from the root category where is allowed tro explore.
        Returns:
        A list with all the groups of categories which can be accessed from the given root and are at most at maxDistance from the root category . All the groups has been scored and are indexed by the distance from the root category. It means, the position 0 of the list only contains the root category because it is the unique category at distance 0 from itself; the position i contains all the categories at distance i from the root category.

      • getDomainCategories

        public java.util.Set<Category> getDomainCategories(java.util.List<GroupOfCategories> scoredGroups,
                                          double threshold)
        Obtains the categories of all the groups which compose a domain.
        Parameters:
        scoredGroups - List of GroupOfCategories to check.
        threshold - Minimum score allowed.
        Returns:
        Set of categories which belong to a specific domain.
